Fetches and returns the distance between two cities from the distances array

float distance between the two cities
Parameters:
city1first city
city2second city
vector< string > MiddleEarth::getItinerary ( unsigned int  length)

returns list of cities to travel to

Returns a vector of city names to travel to. The first city is the original start point as well as the end point. The number of cities passed in does not include this start/end point (so there will be length+1 entries in the returned vector).

Returns:
vector of city names
Parameters:
lengthnumber of cities not including the start/end point

The mouth of Sauron describing Middle-Earth

void MiddleEarth::printTable ( )

prints table of distances to console

creates a tab-separated table of the distances between the cities (can be loaded into Excel etc.)
